column1: I've requested a badge reset. Only 4 days in. Damn how bitter failure tastes!I went to a christmas dinner with a bunch of friends I only see from time to time now, and went all the process, meal included, with alcohol-free beer and water, feeling fine and in control, but at one point <e1>they started doing shots and toasting</e1> and <e2>the pressure to just do one to toast" went up</e2>. I took one

<e1>My primary physican dx me with MDD years ago</e1>. <e2>My old psychiatrist dx me with bipolar II and borderline last month</e2>before screwing with my meds so much I fired him (he took me off wellbutrin cold turkey and I got suicidal). <e3>My new psychiatrist is questioning the last doctor's diagnoses and is now suggesting I actually have complex ptsd and ADHD</e3>. At this point I don't really care what it is as long as we treat it, but damn, <e4>it's hard to apply for disability without a solid diagnosis</e4>. Ugh and blargh.

I don't know if this qualified as suicidal or just depression, but I need to talk about it. <e1>I regularly have intrusive thoughts about death, and thinking about what it would be like to die</e1>. I believe a big issue is that <e2>my parents view my older brother (24 yrs old) as somewhat of a failure</e2>, which results in <e3>them viewing me (20 yrs old) as perfect</e3>. I never drink, do somewhat well in school, and have never done any recreational drugs. I just finished my third semester of business school which I don't know if I passed all my classes, and after talking to my friend about life, I realize that I am seriously stressed out and depressed after I almost asked him if he wonders what being dead is like. I say death because <e4>it is the only comparison that i can think of where you have absolutely no stress or worries or obligations.</e4> <e5>You don't need to pay bills, or complete school, or anything.</e5> It sounds like bliss. Is there a way to deal with thoughts like these, or a way to rationalize this?

Hey everyone, hope you are well.My story isn't like everyone here, I don't have an alcohol addiction but I have done some stupid shit that I'm not proud of when under the influence of alcohol and the hangovers are the worst I've had in years. I only really drink on weekends when meeting up with friends but I had decided a while ago to atleast try and cut it out for a while and see how I feel. I was doing really well, I know how many of this sub say to avoid but <e1>I've even gone to barsclubs</e1> and <e2>not felt pressured or felt the need to drink alcohol</e2>.Tonight I had my work Christmas party, <e3>we were waiting around for the waitress</e3> so <e4>we could sit down and have our meal</e4>, most people were drinking except a few. I don't know where I felt the need to do it but I had a fuck it" moment and <e5>I ordered myself a beer </e5>as <e6>I felt that it might make the night more fun for me</e6>

I'm sitting in my nice, tidy apartment enjoying my Christmas tree and a bottle of San Pell. What a wonderful day off it has been, I can't even begin to tell you all. About this time last year my apartment was trashed and so was I, my boyfriend and family didn't wanna be around me and there were no presents or tree in sight. I'm so grateful for how my life has been turned COMP!ETELY around, and I want to thank all of you, my friends, my family, and my boyfriend for supporting me through all of this. I'm almost six months sober guys!!!!!!!!!! (See how excited I am, haha) I'm counting down the days till January 6th. I will not drink today, I will not drink that day, and I will not drink the day after that. I'm just so happy guys, wanna share the love. ;3 keep it up guys, we can do this!

I don't know what to do. I don't know what can help. One thing is <e1>I'm not expressing my anger most of the time</e1> so <e2>I don't hurt people</e2>, but <e3>I end up being even more angry to myself</e3>. It makes <e4>me hate myself </e4>and just makes me want to punch people in the face but I cannot!!!!! I don't know how to manage it, I dont know how to express it, I am currently in therapy but it only can do so much. God fucking damn it what do I do?!??!?!!

So I just got home for Christmas break after a particularly challenging semester. Now I suddenly have no papers to write or classes to attend and I'm more anxious than I have been in weeks. Just wondering if anyone else can relate. Can school work become a compulsion? When does a good work ethic cross the line into compulsive behavior?

How is it that <e1>I can go to an exam and focus for 3 hours on a single topic while at home I can only focus for a couple minutes at best</e1>?<e2> Distractions</e2>, I suppose... but the only reason <e3>I'm not distracted during the exam </e3>is because <e4>they will give me a zero if I take out my phone or do anything else but sit there and do the work</e4>. How do you make this happen in real life? Eliminating distractions is practically impossible. I can leave my phone at home and take a notebook and the textbook somewhere, but I can still just leave and come back home. This shit is difficult, but I do like the idea of having this necessity thing and implementing it somehow. I mean there must be a way to trick my brain into doing what I want it to do... I mean, I just finished writing a 6 page essay in a couple hours in an exam room while anywhere else it can take me literally weeks to even synthesize a coherent thought in writing.

My bestfriend suffers from BDD, I want to help but I don't know how. A bit of backstory is, when she was younger she used to be quite fat and throughout the recent years she's wanted to be skinny and fit and has worked hard to do so, but at one point in time she got really skinny and unhealthy but shes put some weight back on, still underweight but not super unhealthy, she craves to be skinnier and she wants to be like she used to be which is just unhealthy. <e1>She is very anxious and self conscious of her weight</e1>and <e2>it's driving her mad</e2>, she really needs help.I'm helping her look for a therapist but I want to know if there's anything I myself can do to help her in the meanwhile. If ANYONE has ANY suggestions or help it would be appreciated a ton. Thank you so much.

Hey everyone, I'm new on this sub and I'm really glad I found y'all. I'm a 19 yo guy, and I just dropped out of college due to a jolly fun mix of DepressionAnxietyADHD. The depression and anxiety I was diagnosed with about 5 months ago, and I've been on Effexor since. But the ADHD I was JUST diagnosed with a few days ago, after seeing a specialist a bunch and AFTER dropping out of school. So yeah life is going great right now...I'm reaching out to you all because I'd love advice on how to handle this moving forward. I know a lot of change needs to happen if I'm going to learn how to function and succeed. Is it even possible to really succeed with this? So what's your story? <e1>My life is falling apart</e1> and I just found out it's thanks to <e2>ADHD</e2>. How did your life change around your diagnosis?
For example, more socialless social, more terse or more talkative, spontaneous, etc. Just curious what you guys experience after discussing this with a friend the other day! Thanks!

I was diagnosed a few weeks ago, but just got my prescription this weekend. I was so excited to <e1>take the first dose (adderall ir, 10mg) and get my Christmas list done</e1>.<e2> It mostly made me feel tired and spacey </e2>(is that a thing?) but I got most of it done anyway! Decorating, more decorating, so much decorating, important insurance business I kept procrastinating on, progress on making a Christmas present, cancelling a few monthly subscription services I totally don't need. It feels great to get stuff done. If I can do it, you can definitely do it :D. Thanks for listening.

Hey y'all, quick question - I'm starting to have some major concerns about the loss of appetite my meds give me. Quick bit of background: I'm female, ADHD-pi, 5 ft 6 in, and consistently weighed 110 lbs before my dosage increase. About a month and a half ago <e1>my doctor upped my Concerta dose from 36mg to 54mg daily</e1>, and since then <e2>I've started losing weight</e2>which really concerns me because I'm already built pretty petite (last night I weighed in at 103 lbs...) I've since spoken to him and plan on dropping down to my previous dose, but I'm concerned that the appetite loss (and subsequent weight loss) will still be an issue.How do you guys get yourselves to eat even when you really don't want to? I really need to gain back my lost weight as I'm already at a pretty dangerous point, and really don't want to swap meds again if I can avoid it as the Concerta has been working wonderfully for my ADHD.

Should I take a small dose?I was on celexa 20mg for 2 weeks, then down to 10mg for 10 days. I have not taken it for 5 days. Should I take 5 mg?I was on zolaft for 7 days prior to celexa, and paxil 7 days prior to the zolaft.

I constantly feel annoying and like a terrible person. I have few friends and am constantly questioning why they like me. Today, my friends were all talking about a serious issue having to do with a family member, and <e1>I just butt in, without listening to find out what was being talked about, talking about some useless triumph of my own</e1>. Now <e2>the friend who has the sick family won't talk to me and i feel like my other friends are trying to act like they're not angry too and I feel so awful</e2>. I've apologized as much as I can but I can't stop feeling like they'll never talk to me again and I will lose the only friends I have. I often wonder why no one likes me and then I do something like that and I know exactly why

My brother-in-law is getting married next week in Ireland and both my wife and I are in the wedding. We fly out to Saturday to spend 2 days in London, and then the rest of the week in Ireland. We have a 3 year old, 1 year old, and are expecting our 3rd next summer. It will be the first time we both have let the kids for longer than 2 nights. I have never traveled overseas before and as a private pilot myself, I NEVER have a fear of flying until this month. It's my passion, I LIVE to go to the airport. <e1>My instructor died in a plane crash in July</e1>, since then <e2>I have avoided flying on my own</e2>. We've been getting a will and poa's done for kids just in case something happens to us. The more I talk about it and think about it, I am truly worried that our plane won't make it. I think I have started to psyc myself out. I have even joked to several people, If I don't make it back...". It's really starting to freak me out

I'm just terrified that people are going to hate my gifts. I feel like <e1>I haven't put my usual amount of care and time into my gift giving this year</e1> because <e2>I've been paralyzed by procrastinating everything important for weeks</e2>, so I'm worried everyone else is putting more time into their gifts for me than I am and they're going to hate them. But this thought process is also keeping me from being productive at all and I just want to go to bed. Edit- thanks for your responses, it's nice to know I'm not the only one.

Hello,I have made very few deep connections with people in my life. As they are graduating college before me, I feel as though they are leaving my life forever. I see them with their other friends, and I feel as though they are my only friends, I do not have the luxury of other groups of friends.<e1>I am worried about seeing my family less and less</e1> as <e2>I move into the real world</e2>, and I cant imagine life without them.I am stuck dreading the future and imagining the worst. I have no confidence in my ability to become successful and to balance my work and life.How can I help deal with this? Are there any good resources?Thanks

My sister and I grew up in a dysfunctional family with a bipolar mother, and an abscent father (who had to keep track of our mother's antics as well as trying to make ends meet economically). Soon <e1>after being diagnosed with GAD four years ago, my big sister took her life</e1>.<e2>I've always had this constant feeling of being on edge, sort of jumpy or startled</e2>, like when you miss the last step in a set of stairs.<e3>I recently lost my job</e3>, which triggered an intense feeling of worry. I have since then been offered a new, more attractive position with a higher salary, but the anxiety is the same.Any advice on tackling the day-to-day anxienty out there?I would also love some advice on how to break the news to my dad and stepmom that I have the exact same disorder that killed my sister.

There were too many people in the house this morning. They were making cookies and it created a HUGE mess. I **hate** messes with a passion. And what makes it more annoying is that nobody else seems to care! I'm not OCD about it, really, I'm not. But it's just like, whyyyy??? I'm always picking stuff up or putting things back in their place. I opened a cupboard this morning and I literally shook my head. We have a lot of Tupperware, it used to be organized. Now, it's such a disaster that it's almost laughable in a sad way.I'm super annoyed and cranky and I'm craving a beer (or a few) cause I know it'll bring me down. But at the same time I'll have thrown the last 8 days away that I've worked *sooooooo* hard for. I don't want to do that, at all. And I know that, most likely, I'll get addicted to it and become that person again who hates them self. Pfffft!!! Thanks for letting me vent rstopdrinking. Imma take a shower and get out of the house before I go crazy in the coconut and make a decision I'll regret.

I have known for a long time that i have a problem, i visited aa couple of times but was <e1>unable to open up between a large group of people</e1> so <e2>i stopped</e2>. For a while almost 12 days i stopped completely but then it started again.It has not yet affected my work (at least i like to think that way), i wait till i am at home and start drinking around 7 or 8 and don't stop until i pass out, that goes on every day.Is it possible that i can find a sponsor or someone around here that can help me walk through this?

Hi.  I've been an alcoholic for about 10 years. I am a mother of two.  <e1>My alcohol problem got worse</e1> after <e2>my divorce</e2>.I am four years out from the divorce, and two years into a new relationship.My new partner knows about my drinking problem.  But, he does things to enableencourage it.  We will be driving home from wherever and he will ask do you want to stop for beer?"...when I haven't drank for 3-5 days.  Or I will be ranting about XYZ and he asks if I would like to go for a drink.I talk to him about not wanting to drink.  I know I have a problem...Ugh.The very worst was a week ago

I'm worried about my best friend. He says he is clinically depressed and thinks about suicide a lot. I'm worried that he may act on those thoughts some day. <e1>More than anything I want to be there for him</e1>, so <e2>I need to make sure I understand what he needs</e2>, and <e3>I need to understand clinical depression</e3>. <e4>I need to make sure that if I have the chance to talk him out of suicide I can</e4>. Of course,  I plan on doing independent research and listening to my friend, but if you folks could help me out by sharing what you have learned about clinical depression and talking people out of suicide from your experiences, it might help. That said, if anyone is actually brave enough to make themselves vulnerable by talking about their experiences, which can be very sensitive, I would like to request that we all be respectful towards each other. Thank you ;3

So I'm currently having to decide what I'm gonna study in college, etc.I've been pretty depressed for a few months and sometines I can actually think positive and kinda halt my depression.But now I'm honestly questioning if living my life is worth it.I know there might be some tough shit but some amazing stuff as well. But is it worth it?Also, being realistic, my life's been really boring so far. I don't go out, I have few friends but <e1>I moved to another city</e1> and <e2>we pretty much only talk through skyp and play some stuff together</e2>. I'm not an attractive person, I'm not fit, I'm not funny, social and I'm just relatively smart but I'm way too lazy. Yeah it's been over one and a half decade and I have no great amazing memories since my days are pretty much the same.So my actual question is: is living worth? But more specifically, is it worth trying to change my flaws in order to make life interesting? It's not gonna be easy and I'm not sure if it's really gonna be worth it.That's all, sorry for the long post.

Anyone else with undiagnosed ADHD have trouble finding a job? I've graduated and have been on several job interviews where I just seem to fail. It's been  6 months since graduation. I've seen one provider who didnt think I had ADHD. Will this be a blessing in disguise and help me get the diagnosis I truly need? Feeling so frustrated and a little defeated.

The only thing keeping me from doing it is my family (no friends) that would be devastated if I did it. <e1>I've seen how an accidental death (of my cousin) can ruin lives</e1>, and <e2>I refuse to actively cause grief like that</e2>. I just really wish that no one cared about me so I could just pull the trigger and end it all. I screwed up my life. I was supposed to be a prodigy, but I only ended up getting into a lower tier ivy league school. I'm about to graduate phi beta kappa  but I feel like such a worthless, dumb piece of shit. It's unbearable. Thanks for reading.

I just started back on my Welbutrin yesterday and just woke up from a dream about my ex (that I've wanted to kill myself over when we broke up) this morning.I was at my old high school and saw him. Then it turned slightly lucid and I knew if I opened this random door it'd lead into his bedroom. I went in and some guy came in and I was scared and ended up crying for my ex to please help me.I was actually yelling his name so much that I was afraid my new bf, who was sleeping right next to me, would hear. (Sometimes I talk in my sleep.)<e1>I feel like shit now</e1>. Because <e2>I've been trying to get over him but this feels like a major setback</e2>. Because <e3>I feel so guilty to my now boyfriend</e3>.I'm not sure why I made this, guess sort of venting and something else.

Hi there, I'm a binge drinker for over 15 years... monthly on average.  I've recently discovered this whole low carb high fat diet trend that's supposed to balance your blood sugar levels and control cravings for carbs.  (I can eat a whole pack of family sized tim-tams in a sitting lol) I'm wondering if anyone has used this sort of thing (ie, rketo ) to help curb their cravings and balance their life out a bit? I'm pretty sure the weight loss and health improvements would be  a massive benefit anyway.  Thoughts?

Just had a pretty dramatic break-up with my ex, check out my [post](https:www.reddit.comrrelationshipscomments3y0qomi_21_m_just_launched_a_social_media_callout_to_my) in relationships if interested.Some interesting things I discovered from comparing my relationship experience before and after I took the meds (Vyvanse 50mg):- Before: I used to be this indifferent, passionless but chilled dude that had zero conflicts with my ex. However, <e1>I  also made zero effort in advancingtaking care of the relationship</e1> which (presumably) resulted in <e2>she cheated on me<e2>.- After: I slowly became this socially awkward (more so) and overly-attached guy that just wanted to be with her forever. To the point where I stopped caring about my social and academic life, as long as I got to be with her. For instance, <e3>she was pretty much the only person I hung out with during the entire last Summer</e3>. <e4>I did not care to socialize with any other of my friends because I never felt the need to</e4>. Similarly, <e5>I would risk failing a course that is required to graduate, just to help her review another insignificant course</e5>, because <e6>I valued everything about her much more important than mine</e6>

I have been on vyvanse since 2012. The doctor that prescribed, or actually nurse, she was an RN, runs a not for profit business in Charlotte, but <e1>she is currently out of the country (canada) and can't fax my medical info to my new doctor</e1>. I am currently in Indiana, and now am running out of my medication. <e2>My nurse usually would call it in for me, but she left and she said she can't do it in Indiana</e2>. <e3>My mother is having her leg amputated this week</e3>so <e4>I am stuck here and will be here until her recovery</e4>. <e5>All and most shrinks and doctors I have called are either booked or of course not open for the upcoming holiday</e5>.....Is there any chance to go to a walk in clinic like a medical center for something like this? That is what my mother suggested. Any and all advice is greatly appreciated! Thanks in advance!

I'm not sure if this is the right place but is there a sub where you can just find someone to talk to about whats on your mind? It all builds up without anyone to open up to and it is getting really crippling.

<e1>I'm going to a pub for drinks tomorrow for the first time (I'm 18 so it's new to me) and I am anxious about it</e1>, mainly because <e2>I fear not being able to leave for whatever reason</e2> and <e3>I don't actually like the idea of getting really drunk (though I won't as it's Christmas eve) but I fear that people will judge me for leaving earlier or whatever</e3>. I have managed to go to a social event before despite anxiety and when there I KNOW I am fine, but that doesn't stop the anticipatory anxiety, which can be enough to stop me from actually going to the event, which happened recently. My friends know about my anxiety which does help but I do find it hard. Anyone got any tips for the anticipation before the event?
Please tell me few advices :( <e1>I am calm now</e1> but that is only because <e2>I am too tired to cry or to hit myself</e2>. I am literally exhausted

Hi everyone! I have looked through our subreddit a bit, and have noticed that some people have been looking for accountability partners. I was wondering if anyone was willing to work with me, whether it be one other person or a small group. I am envisioning checking in before bed each night to write down a schedule of events and tasks for the next day, and saying how that day's plans went. It'll be a supportive thing, but also a kick in the butt thing. We can either do a daily post here in this subreddit, or if we feel that it would clutter this page up too much, we can post to a separate subreddit (I made rADHDAccountability just in case, but we don't have to use it).Anyone interested?

So after <e1>the stress of finals and the holidays</e1>1 definitely <e2>feeling anxious</e2>. However, <e3>I started watching some nature documentaries</e3> at night after work while cleaning  wrapping presents etc. I noticed that <e4>I was feeling incredibly calm after leaving them on in the background</e4>. In particular any series narrated by David Attenborough seems to help me, and quite a bit is available on Netflix. There's just something about that soothing British accent and watching beautiful environments and learninglistening to factual descriptions that <e5>gets me out of my stressing and obsessing about everything</e5>" mental loop."

I don't know what has come over me. I'm on the way to the airport to travel home to Chicago, and I am suddenly paralyzed with fear. The thought of standing in lines and crowds and sitting on an airplane is all of a sudden terrifying to me. I'm wondering if it is general anxiety about my sober trip presenting as acute fear.Airports have always been my favorite place to drink. I pray that I am able to make it through today sober. Just today. I'll worry about tomorrow, tomorrow. I need you guys to be with me today.
i need to stop whining and cowboy up for this rodeo lol ... merry christmas all

When I came here I was looking for some support and boy did I ever get it!<e1>I only got through my first 30 days</e1> because of <e2>the support from you guys</e2>.<e3>I only decided to give AA a valid try</e3>because of you guys. <e4>I have my 24 hour coin</e4> because of you guys. When I talked to my doctor initially, she said online groups aren't  going to help but you guys saved me! I have a long way to go but I now have a home AA group, an amazing sponsor and I have my sea legs about this whole sobriety thing! I love you all, I hope you have peaceful holidays and are able to find your personal path to revovery! ;3

Along taking 50mg Vyvanse, I'm trying to start regular aerobiccardio excercise which is recommended for help in coping with adhd symptoms. When I got on the eliptical today I had taken the meds a hour before hand. But, it seemed way too easy on the maxlchine. I don't know if this is from me doing this more regularly or if it was timing after taking the meds. I was glad I did so well, but a part if me is afraid that this was a positive reaction to the meds which makes me afraid of performance dropping if I had to stop the meds for some reason.What has been your experience with excercising while on stimulants?  Looks like I was a bit scattered with the background story. Makes you think I have ADD or something....

Eight hours in and people are still as excited about it. I am happy for them but I honestly can understand why kids cry when you force them to be somewhere they don't want to be. I would do anything right now to just have access to a car for an hour or so so I can and drive somewhere on my own and maybe buy an energy drink or something.

So I havnt drank in about 15 hours give or take, and just feel terrible. I tried to get to bed early last night so I can be okay for work today, but I was tossing and turning all night and couldn't stop sweating even tho I was really cold. So I'm wondering am I just coming down with a flue or are these actual wd symptoms?

It has come to my attention that one thing normal people tend to do instinctively that is harder for people with ADHD to do is to give themselves pep-talks, <e1>think encouraging words to encourage to do stuff and self-soothe</e1>.I never do this, except when <e2>I get really frustrated with myself</e2>, and yell at myself to just stfu and do it already!"

Sober. This is weird too. Our host is toast typically I'm trying to catch up. But I'm staying true. I did notice one of the other big drinkers has a bottle of Pepsi he is nursing. I got to chat with a whole different set of people. I'm off to the kid's house to watch my grandbaby open gifts... If you are on the fence about quitting, just quit. In one week I hit a year, and I have wonderful memories from this year. Just wanted to check in and wish everyone a happy and sober whatever you celebrate!

For example, I'm feeling pretty anxious today and within an hour I've bounced back and forth to  washing laundry, doodlingwriting in my journal, browsing the internet, reading a book, and watching" a movie that I put on before all this "

Two Thursday's ago, December 10th, I had my last drink. This is the longest I've gone without alcohol in more than three years, ; after drinking daily for the past two years. I didn't think I'd be able to go this long ever, ; <e1>I'm very proud of myself for getting this far</e1>. I've said it before, ; I'll say it again, I wouldn't've been able to do this without <e2>my supporting family</e2>; relaxing chamomile tea, ; the support of this loving community. Thank you all for the encouraging words ; support. I hope everyone has a lovely Christmas

This will be the first Christmas I'll wake up sober in so long that I'm not sure the exact number, but we will say 15-20 years anyway. So, great news, right? This is where the irony comes in, <e1>I'm so sick</e1> from <e2>this cold</e2> I'm trying to fight off that I'm going to wake up feeling like crap anyway! I'll still count it as a win, this cold can't take this away from me! Have a Very Merry Christmas everyone, I'm grateful to all of you more than I can properly articulate. Goodnight :)

<e1>I've been living with mental illness for a very long time</e1>. <e2>It is very difficult to keep friends, hold a job, or even live a normal life</e2>. <e3>Lately I've been having trouble being around couples or seeing anything sexual</e3>. <e4>Every time I see anything sexual I've been cutting myself</e4>. It's gotten pretty bad. Now I am contemplating suicide. I don't know whats wrong with me. I am often confused at why I feel the way I do. Even thinking about this now is making me want to hurt myself.  I just wish I could be like everyone else. This sucks.

Don't know if this kind of post is appropriate for this subreddit. I'm not really suicidal (as in wanting to kill myself) at the moment, and even if I were, for better or worse, I'm currently too much of a coward to do that sort of thing in the near future. Nonetheless, I've been struggling with depression and self-esteem issues for quite a while now, and it's really gotten worse lately. Would really appreciate it if someone would be willing to spend some of their time with me on Skype. If this is not the right subreddit for this sort of thing, do point me someplace better. Thank you.

I'm ruining everyone's day.  I have no positive influence on the world.   The rational decision is suicide.  There isn't one thing I enjoy and I'm just called a pussy for being depressed.  The drugs are helping but from hell to bad isn't fun.  Now it's hell again.  I have nothing.  They're all gone.  I tried to play steam sale games but now I'm just bad at everything.  I don't need a response I'm just venting and sad

Another night where I spend hours trying to fall asleep but can't.  <e1>I've had depression for many, many years</e1> but haven't killed myself yet because of family.  <e2>When I try to fall asleep most of the time</e2>, I usually can't unless I'm totally exhausted, and I write down my thoughts if I can't fall asleep, which usually just ends up being a paragraph on why I hate my life and why I should kill myself.  I don't know where to go to make things better and I don't want to bother my family with this shit anymore.  I don't know what to do to be happy, I've had years of therapy which didn't do jack shit, and I'm on anti-depressants and still wanna kill myself.  I've heard everything in the book people said about feeling better, but still feel like trash, which makes posting here seem pointless, but hey I'm still hanging by a thread and it's something I haven't tried yet so why the hell not.  I just don't want to live this life, learn and work, it's such a boring cycle and realizing it makes me wish I hadn't been born because I'm already sick of it.

In time for the holidays. I fluctuate, but my suicidal feelings have come to me again. They seem to come in waves, every four months or so, they return, to ruin my life and push my closer and closer to the edge. I've endured before, I've told myself it will get better, that I will improve myself and move onto something bigger and better. In some ways, maybe I have. I've lost weight, but I'm also leaving university without a degree, and I feel bitter, lost, confused, and defeated. My family is fractured, and even over these holidays, I'm spending them alone. I think I'm beginning to see why suicide rates increase over the holidays.

In addition to turning me down, a girl who means a lot to me is moving an hour away to a town that has no busses and I can't drive. I thought I had plans to see Star Wars with her, but that turned out to be a joke. Meanwhile, <e1>my grades declined to the point</e1>that <e2>my parents decided to stop paying for me to go to college</e2>and <e3>they insist that two weeks from now I either pick a community college to go to or a job to apply to</e3>. I suggested that they rent a room for me to live with my friends, but e4they turned that down because they want to punish me e4for my grades. Some of my friends have offered for me to live with them and not pay any rent, but I'm scared to talk to my parents about that after what happened last time I talked about living with friends. Also, all my friends live too far away for me to see them if I don't live with them.

I've had a permanent miagraine for coming up to 2 years now. How it happened is irrelevant. I'm 17 and it makes me fearful for my life, despite having numerous tests (MRI, MRA, ECG, EEG, CT and so many bloodtests its impossible to keep track of) for any nasty things. Despite all this, i am in constant pain and in constant uknowing about whats going to happen. Pain spikes often right up the back of my head, like a cold rush, followed by blurred vision and weakness. Its fucking shit, honestly. Like what if it's an aneurysm and they didnt find it? Quite frankly I want to die because this is a little shit. I'm not sure if this should go on a different subreddit or not but i want to be free or something. I've had counciling and theyre all preeeeeetty useless. I dont even understand why ive posted this or continued to write it as ive realised nothing will coke from this. I want to die but i want to keep living. pls help

I'm in bed now after Christmas eve and day at my parents with my brother and sister there as well. I felt so much at home, like I didn't have to pretend to be somebody else. I'm getting tested for adhd in two weeks, I suspect there us also so ASS in the mix. During dinner and the board games we played afterward I recognized so many symptoms in my family as well, especially in my brother and sister. I was afraid Christmas was going to be exhausting, but I felt so much at ease with my fam, just all being our quirky selves,  busy, noisy, rambling, but all in a fun way. Just wanted to share!  Merry Christmas to you all!

I noticed that <e1>when I meet someone that seems to be shy quiet not very outgoing</e1> <e2>I start wondering if they have SA</e2> and if <e3>they are going through the same stuff as I do</e3>. And then when they do something that requires great social skill I just get disappointed and I feel like 'they are not like me'. I don't know how to describe this feeling. Like I am desperately looking for someone that might go through the same, but in real life. Do you ever experience it?

I'm still getting used to all this, 2 months ago I was happy go lucky, and the rock for my family, but now I feel like I'm watching myself fall apart. <e1>My elbow has been bothering me and I've pretty much determined it's ulnar nerve entrapment</e1>, so <e2>10 min ago I was laying in bed keeping my arm straight to relieve the tingling</e2>. Then <e3>it felt like someone poured warm water down the back of my neck</e3> and I knew <e4>I was going to have a panick attack</e4>.I started shivering a little first, like I was cold, then my whole body started trembling.  But recognizing it early I began to move around and drink some water, and run a bath.  Now I'm sitting in the bath, and it really wasn't that bad, but I hate that I have to deal with this shit.

I don't know if <e1>Vyvanse made me this way</e1> or it's more like a <e2>common trait for ADHD</e2>.Basically I find <e3>myself overly-concerned with certain issues that most normal people wouldn't consider as a lifedeath kind of deal</e3>.Story:Recently I was mad at this <e4>ex-girlfriend who cheated on me</e4>, so <e5>I decided to (legally) advertise all her dirty history (facts) everywhere I could</e5>.- Part of myself was telling me this is childish, I should just move on otherwise everyone would think of me as that creepy overly-attached weirdo and all kinds of bad stuff are going to happen on me.- The worst thing is, somehow I am okay with that. I've noticed that <e1>when I am going to be somewhere that is full of new things, or things I am interested in</e1>, <e2>I have to make sure I'm medicated first</e2>. If I don't, <e3>I get such a bad case of what feels like motion sickness</e3>that <e4>I have to remove myself from as much sensory input as possible (laying down or sitting, closing eyes, etc.) until medicine kicks in</e4>. What happens when you've been trying to improve your situation for so long, and after 2 years of struggle and misery things have actually gotten worse? I fell for the trap, I actually led myself to believe that <e1>things can only get better</e1> if <e2>I put my time and energy into it</e2>, the soul crushing feeling of being in a worse state than when you started off, holy shit, i'd actually be okay if after all this struggle, tears and hard work things hadn't changed, but <e3>they got WORSE</e3>, and <e4>i'm just about done</e4>.i guess i'm gonna go lay down for a bit, i don't know, apparently i can't move forward, i have nothing to strive for, i'm stuck in a painful downward spiral that i can't or don't know how to get out of. i wish i could go back in time, and in a year i'll wish i could go back to where i am now.

haven't had it for maybe a year and a half. Maybe two. <e1>Somebody drove up my driveway, sat in front of my house for a second and drove off</e1>. <e2>I live in a rural area</e2>, and <e3>there's no reason anyone would ever drive down my driveway, or let alone my road</e3>. All day these things are in the back of my mind. It was never this bad. <e1>They are close friends and they made a joke</e1>, I blushed a bit, they called me on it, <e2>I blushed more and more until I had to hide my face while they made comments about my blushing</e2>. <e3>It made me so sad</e3>. <e4>It made me mad at them</e4>. <e5>I feel like avoiding them for a long time</e5>. <e6>That feeling was horrible</e6>. <e7>It felt like I was going to explode</e7>. I'm scared how I'll never forget it. I know it's not s big deal but the bad feeling won't leave.

I have dealt with depression and anxiety since I was 18, currently 26. I have tried therapy and meds throughout. It's <e1>my anxiety</e1> that is the biggest problem really. It can just be so unrelenting.  Constant worry over everything and nothing at the same time. <e2>Just overall feeling uncomfortable</e2>. <e3>Sometimes the only thing I can do is lay in bed tightly tuckd in to the blanket to comfort me</e3>.I've always been rational about my thoughts and feelings.  I know it's an imbalance. I know it's inherited. But lately I have been thinking a lot about how I would do it, and it worries me. It worries me because it's not an upset reaction this time. It's not feeling of I deserve to die or I'm worthless. My thoughts this time feel calming to me. Like an open door. A way to stop the uncomfort within my own skin.This time I feel like it's not giving up, but giving in.

No matter how hard I try I have trouble making friends in this new town.

I'm always thinking about stuff like how awesome its going to be to play a video game, or how awesome its going to be to watch the rest of a certain tv show. I have been drinking heavily since senior year of high school. My drinking has snowballed into me coming home from work every evening drinking up to a litre of what ever alcohol I can get my hands on. Friends and family acknowledge my alcoholism as do I. At this point I don't want to stop drinking and don't see my self putting the bottle down for the foreseeable future

Anger post So for the past few years, starting roughly in my freshman year of high school, I've slowly become more and more angry with each passing day and year. I say it started my freshman year because that's when I started having extreme outburst. I'm 20 years old now and the problem continues to progress. Outbursts are still extremely rare but when I get angry it's getting harder and harder to exhibit anything even remotely resembling self-control. When <e1>I'm really riled up, I act in an extremely destructive fashion, breaking things, fights, etc</e1>. I also generally cannot be reasoned with. Part of the reason for this is that, in a way, <e2>I enjoy being angry</e2>. <e3>I feel warm</e3>. <e4>I feel alive</e4>. <e5>I revel in the feeling of power and strength</e5>. <e6>I feel free" in a sense</e6>. I walk around with the feeling that sometimes I have a monster inside and he is tired of being controlled. And as someone who grew up in an extremely religious household with a lot rules

<e1>I was diagnosed ADHD after I graduated college</e1>, which I thought, explained <e2>my odd reckless behavior and horrible grades</e2>. After treating my ADHD with Adderall, I was able to achieve things I normally wouldn't have been able to. However, I noticed I struggle in a massive way with holding a job for period of time. I've been unemployed throughout graduate school, living on student loans and every time I go for an interview, I feel like I am being judged. Is it normal to feel like an imposter even though I truly have this disorder? I just hope to get a good job already so I can stabilize my personal life that is in shambles.

Anybody experience extreme irritability on Concerta? <e1>I've gone from 18mg to 54mg over the past three months</e1>. As my dose increased, I noticed my <e2>irritability getting worse</e2>. I started going to bed at around 10pm and waking up at 6am every day, eating better and getting moderate exercise to rule out any lifestyle possibilities and found that as my dosage increased, I started to get more irrationally irritable about stupid things. After my lifestyle change I was more conscious about it and could tell when I was being ridiculous vs when I had an actual reason to be irritated, and I can compare it best to someone on their period crying and knowing they don't have a reason to be sad but unable to stop crying. I have also noticed that irritability is my only emotion on Concerta, and when I have a reason to cry or be upset I almost feel numb. This is the same with happiness as well but to a lesser degree. Anyone have similar experiences?

I dont know if this is <e1>an ADHD problem</e1>, but starting about this winter <e2>I haven't been able to get a grasp on anything kinda abstract</e2>. Like I can learn facts and stuff just fine, but its my abstract reasoning and comprehension that's just gone.For example, I used to read 1 or more non-fiction book(usually about business, psychology, self help, economics, skillstrades) a week and be able to use it and remember it. Now even if I take detailed notes or use a commonplace book, it's just like empty reading. No blog post or article or book that's supposed to help" means anything to me anymore and I just cant make it stick like it used to.I play a little bit of dota too

<e1>Whenever I start talking to someone in real life, they seem to have a weirded out expression on their face</e1>. For example, I recently went to my bank to deposit some money, and as I approached and started talking to the cashier about wanting to deposit the money, the expression on her face suggested that she was weirded out be me.I didn't do anything weird as far as I know - I simply asked to deposit some money.I deposited my money successful and all that, but now I'm afraid of interacting with others even more than before. Am I just being paranoid? What could help me improve?This isn't the first time this happens. In fact, situations like this tend to happen rather often, and cause <e2>me great anxiety and lower my confidence</e2>.

<e1>Suffers depression</e1>. Failed all my exams earlier this year. So now I'm just trying to survive the everyday life of depression. Surviving through the day. But my new retake exam is in one week. I tried to open my book today. <e2>I could hardly read the words</e2>. Evertything I had once known, was like symbols that didn't make sense. <e3>I got stressed. Then I got scared. Then deeply sad</e3>. I went to the sofa, laid down, fell asleep for 15 minutes in tears.I woke up again. I remembered the mindfulness course I have been trying to hook on to. I scanned myself, calming my head. Calming my body. I took my everyday-stress glasses off my nose. Took my I'm so worried and the world is out after me"-contact lenses off

im in my second year of uni, and have suffered from a <e1>eating disorder and depression</e1> for the last 2 years. it all started when <e2>my dad left</e2> and <e3>my mum died</e3>. <e4>i have no home to go back to</e4> , and <e5>have to live on a camp bed in my sisters rented out room</e5>. when im at uni i feel like ive got know one to talk to about my personal problems, and it seems <e6>the stress of having to worry about my exams</e6> just makes <e7>my bulimia extreme followed by breakdowns of depression</e7>. i constantly have suicidal thoughts. i feel like i should drop out and concentrate on getting myself better and dealing with my personal problems , but know one knows that i have bulimia and severe depression, and am too scared to tell anyone especially my dad. what should i do please help

Hello my dear reddit friends.<e1>Times of celebration can be a hard time forus</e1>, what ever we struggle with <e2>Depression, Anxiety, PTSD, plain old loneliness or whatever is in between</e2>.Last year, I was helped through this by a guy who suggested to build a cozy pillowfort, complete with fairylights - I didnt... I made a big ass Artisinal Bacon Cheese Burger, and it was good, so greasy crunchy good!Point is: Don't get bogged down by societies idea of a new years eve. Do something you like to do, whatever simple pleasure it may be, and it will be a good day. Just do something good for yourself.Seriously it does not matter, what ever small gesture you can do, is better than nothing. and that is all that matters.We are all here, dealing with it in our own ways, you are not alone.To a stronger 2016.

I know it's been said around here before from time to time, but <e1>I finally got a standing desk at work</e1>, and its an absolute GAME CHANGER!Now <e2>when I'm at my desk, I'm constantly focused</e2>. Can't explain it, but when I was sitting, I was more likely to get distracted and drift into the internet or a game on my phone. There's something about standing up that just <e3>keeps me focused on my task at hand</e3>. If you have a desk job, try a standing desk. Amazing.

Sure, I have had my moments of feeling nothing. But my depression inevitably would fade and I'd find a way to feel at least somewhat normal again. But heartbreak has pushed me over the edge. I've had breakups before.  I'd be sad for awhile before moving on. But this time .... it's different.  I don't give a fuck about anything. And I feel like my very soul has been torn from me. I'll be graduating with a MA. But I don't care. I've applied for an internship and have a few job prospects. I don't care.  I have people that love me. I don't care.  I'm going on a dig in a country I haven't been to yet.  I don't care. I'm just ... apathetic. I don't know how to care anymore.

Sometimes I'm too afraid to be honest with my therapist. See, I'm not suicidal, but I think if I described my depression to him, he might get the wrong impression and think I am suicidal. If that happens, then he might try to hospitalize me, which is what I don't want.Basically, I sometimes feel like I don't want to live anymore... yet at the same time, I *don't* want to die. I *don't* want to kill myself. I just wish I didn't exist so that I didn't have to feel the pain. Does that make sense?I had a therapy appointment yesterday, but I totally hid my depression from my therapist. I forced myself to smile and even made a few jokes so that he wouldn't suspect a thing... and there were a handful of times where I almost started crying, but was able to catch myself before that happened. I guess it's because I got really nervous and didn't know what to do.Edit: He already knows that I suffer from major depression from time to time, as I've been diagnosed with bipolar disorder. <e1>He just doesn't know the severity of my depression</e1> and therefore <e2>can't adequately help me yet</e2>

It is so discouraging. I need a written list to remember more than four or five things. My husband will call me when I'm on my way home if we need something from the grocery store. I ask him specifically and directly to send me a list via text because I'm driving and can't write it down. I can check it when I get to the store and I wont overlook anything. Then he will start rattling off more things and I interrupt saying send me a list. He gets frustrated saying you need a list for x

Hi, I'd like to know if anyone else experienced this. <e1>I'm constanly worried about something</e1>, either a potential illness, a bad social situation, self doubt, stuff like that. <e2>I'm talking about negative thoughts and re-living past memories all the time trying to think of ways I should have behaved</e2>. It's anxiety fueled by <e3>OCD</e3> basically. I found out recently that by <e4>focusig on a thought under the form of a sound</e4> then <e5>everything gets automatically better</e5>. Imagine a constant sound, like a musical note, and picture yourself constantly playing that sound in your head on purpose. I realized that by doing this <e6>my thoughts tend to quite down and external factors borher me way less</e6>. It's like the pralyzing low mood that brinngs me down is suddenly gone and I can finally do stuff. Negative emotions are still there but instead of feeling them to the point of being freezes I can move freely just by focusing this way. I'm guessing this is a sort of mindfulnessmeditation but I wanted to hear your thoughts on this.

Hi all,I really like this method of organizing todo lists http:michaelhyatt.comis-that-task-important-or-merely-urgent.html I generally only get my act together to organize things with this once I've already hit the point of being very behind on things. I always end up just scribblinging things down on post-its normally and <e1>this last semester i had too many times where tasks got lost in the shuffle</e1> due to <e2>me not being organized enough</e2>. I want to make the plunge to doing this method each day or week for my tasks but I know if I had a notebook where i have to draw the lines I'll be in a rush and end up telling myself I can just keep track of it in my head and not use the method. I am trying to find somewhere that sells notebooks for this method since it's pretty popular but can't find anything. Anyone know of a place to buy one? <e3>I don't want to use an app</e3> because <e4>I find I write faster than I can pull out a app and write things down</e4> so if it's not on paper it won't happen.

I'm alone on New Year's eve. Yeah, so what? <e1>I'm alone on New Year's</e1> because <e2>I'm too squirrelly to show myself at these dinner parties</e2> and <e3>more than slightly ashamed of myself and somewhat notorious</e3> and <e4>people have told me about their plans but didn't invite me</e4>. But FUCK THAT NOISE. I'M NOT GOING DOWN. I decided I wasn't going to die yesterday and I don't care if I'm alone on New Year's because... well, fuck, I'm not going to let these fuckers murder me. Because it's not suicide. I'd be letting all the abuse and shame just fill me up and kill me. It's not mine. I don't deserve to die. So what if I'm a drug-addled alcoholic" whose "life must be pure hell" (that's my family talking) and is something of a pariah because people don't understand benzo withdrawal or domestic violence? So what? I'm not gong out of this fucking world because some assholes decided I have zero value. Fuck them

New years is just like every other day; it's nothing special. The only reason why <e1>it is considered significant</e1> is because <e2>we've arbitrarily chosen it to be</e2>. So, if you are having a miserable new years, don't fret too much. It's just another day. Never reserve happiness and expectation for holidays. If we treated every day as significant and special, i think we all would be much happier.Many happy returns.

<e1>My husband often is frustrated with me</e1> when <e2>I blurt something out without thinking it through</e2> or <e3>interrupt him with my own thoughts when he's talking about something</e3>. Has anyone been able to explain this aspect of the disorder to someone who doesn't experience impulse control deficits in a way that gets through? I struggle to find ways to help my husband understand that I'm not just rude or uncaring when these situations arise.

I stayed in with my partner and dogs. Had a nice snuggle in bed. I wouldn't have wanted it any other way actually. Did any of you make it out? Did you stay in? Were you happy? Or did you feel isolated and regretful about your agoraphobia on an eve of festivities?

Let me precede this story with some background. Every Wednesday after school I go to my School's Anime club. We were having a holliday party on this particular day. Normally my Father picks me up. On Wednesdays he picks me up later. I go outside to look for my Dad. I forgot today was Wednesday. I go back in and find my friend Matt. He asked me if I could do something and I asked what it was. He told me he wanted me to hold open the door for him so he could bring food and drinks in. I did and helped him bring it up the stairs to the second floor where the anime club was. We walked in like heros. Everyone clapped. He later told me he would have been unable to bring the food in if I wasn't their.TL;DR ADHD made me forget what day it was. Brought food.

So, quick recap. <e1>Got sick last year, blood in stool, abdomen pain, back pain, lost appetite and weight</e1>, <e2>had ton of tests</e2> (blood twice, colonoscopy, endoscopy, ultrasound, CT, check for pancreatitis, lymphoma), docs said I had chronic gastritis and liver function was high but found nothing. Felt better by spring and summer and put weight on but hit October and felt shit again. Had chest pains (felt muscular) doc said referred pain, abdomen pain returned, then had flu symptoms a fortnight ago. Had it on and off for last 2 weeks, aches all over legs, shoulders, arms, back, head, and now my glands are swollen on my neck but not painful. Absolutely crapping myself. Everyone tells me it's just the flu or glandular fever but <e3>I'm so anxious and keep getting worried I'm dying</e3>. What the actual fuck??? My last blood test was showed the liver issue but fine other than that but I have another test for hepatitis and glandular fever. Just worried it's something terminal and that I'll be dead shortly. Urgh... I hate living like this.

I am a project manager, and my job has many duties, just like most people. I tend to make simple mistakes that can either range from no big deal to a decent problem. My wife wants me to unplug but I have the hardest time letting go. <e1>I feel like I am not meant for the business world</e1> because <e2>I am mistake prone</e2> and <e3>I live in fear or being fired</e3>, as <e4>I have once been fired before</e4>. I am constantly worried and hardly feel comfortable in my 9 years of experience past college and grad school. Has anyone ever overcome such a nagging problem.Thanks!

Feels good maaaaaaaaaan. <e1>Made a batch of mead</e1>, and this is the first time in 6 years of medicating that <e2>I was able to do a task for 4 hours without needing a break or getting distracted</e2>. Just felt the impulsive urge to share! Sorry!

I haven't checked in for a while but 554 day sober, woohoo. This feels like such an accomplishment, but it's having its negative impacts.Last night my girlfriend wanted to go out to the bar and celebrate the new year with some mutual friends. That's what started it all. She said this morning that she is tired of me judging her for drinking. I don't of course, but she refuses to believe that. She thinks that I don't have a good time when we go out and that I look down on everyone who is drinking. I've tried explaining that being at a bar is uncomfortable for me and that its hard to keep up with mood of people who drink. She doesn't seem to understand that I quit because I have a problem and that being around that much alcohol and in that kind of atmosphere is very difficult for me.The worst part. We started dating a week after I quit. I knew that this woman was amazing and that if I continued to drink, this relationship would crumble from my drinking. How is it that <e1>my sobriety</e1> is the reason <e2>it's falling apart</e2>.

<e1>I have social and generalized anxiety</e1>, and <e2>I usually jump to the absolute worst conclusions</e2>. (ex. if my mom is ten minutes late picking me up, she was in a wreck and died.) But lately i've noticed that when actually bad things happen, I'm suddenly calm and rational, generally that would be good, but it makes me feel emotionless. Like when my mom was in the hospital, I cried once. When her blood sugar drops, I kind of flatline and make her a sandwich, help her check it, etc. does anyone else experience this? I am taking buspirone, if that helps.EDIT: obligatory wow this blew up!" I'm glad a ton of other people experience this too

Hi all. Happy New Year. <e1>My doctor recently gave me a prescription for xanax</e1> to help manage <e2>my anxiety</e2>. I tried it for the flight from LA to Chicago and had a bad reaction. About two hours into the flight <e3>I got very dizzy, shaky, and nauseated</e3>. I made it to the bathroom (did not vomit),  but collapsed on the floor. I was so hotsweaty. The flight attendant helped me back to my seat and gave me some ginger ale and a cold compress. I felt better shortly after that but I was terribly embarrassed!Full disclosure: I was running on 4 hours of sleep and had not eaten. Has anyone else had a reaction like this? I'm nervous about taking the medication again. Thanks in advance!

I feel as though <e1>I'm going through life in constant fear</e1>. I don't want to, but I don't know how to not always be afraid. There's no reason for me to be afraid and I am only lessening my quality of life. <e2>I am afraid of my husband dying, myself dying, torture, starvation, war</e2>. <e3>I've lived the past 15 years dealing with depression and anxiety with agoraphobia</e3>. Though the agoraphobia is kept in check, I feel that fear is always in the back of my mind. The only way I can go about things is to not think about the fear, not let my mind wander. The thoughts now mostly peak out sometimes at night. I then feel like I'm suffocating in my own irrational fear. <e4>I have to be careful with what I expose myself to - careful what I see in the news</e4>, careful what movies or TV shows I watch. I don't want to be always afraid anymore. I don't know what to do to help myself.

"I go through long phases where I feel the typical <e1>BPD</e1> symptoms and <e2>everything feels all the time</e2>.  But right now I'm in a stage where <e3>I just can't make myself give a shit about hardly anything</e3>.  I like to think it's good, and it's definitely better than the alternative, but sometimes things happen that I know should deeply upset me and it just doesn't seem to matter because that part of my brain is just totally shut off.  <e4>It makes interpersonal relationships hard</e4> because <e5>I simply don't feel anything and people don't matter to me</e5>.  And the worst part is when this calm breaks and everything goes to shit again.  What have you been able to do to find a balance between these?  
"

Hello!I wrote to this sub earlier, but I want to try again. I'm not a linguistics major by any means. Sorry for typos and plot errors. I was in the hospital for about 4 days due to respiratory problems. The pulmonary doctor recommend I get a pulse-ox. It's the little sciencey-plastic bit that goes on your finger in hospital. It reads your oxygen and pulse. When I am anxious, I get my pulse-ox (I have to sit still to use it). It gives me something to look at, remind myself I am not indeed having a heart attack, and I have no choice but to relax.I use it the most when company is due to come, I have to drive, or before making a phone call. No one asks about it. It's a medical device. They have no idea that you're anxious and it's a tool to calm you down.http:www.amazon.com50-DL-Pulse-Oximeter-Neck-WristdpB004BJT9OEref=sr_1_6?s=hpc;ie=UTF8;qid=1452110687;sr=1-6;keywords=pulse+oximeter+fingertipAlso, I like to watch Gallagher. ;)https:youtu.beeQdprOzBxwE

<e1>I have always had really bad social anxiety</e1>, and just anxiety in general. <e2>I have no self confidence and am usually very quiet</e2>. In French class, we were talking about relationships (for some reason), and I was randomly picked on for the question, How do you know if somebody likes you?" <e3>Everybody knows that I am super awkward and rarely talk to anybody</e3>

I haven't been to school for 3 days either. Life is just shit. <e1>Social anxiety so bad</e1> that <e2>I can't even speak to my family</e2> and I am almost a month away from help from the hospital. The date was set to over a month later than the less-than-1-month-guaranteed wait time and I can't even go to a privat hospital to get meds, cause they don't exist. In a few hours it's going to be 72 hours since I last slept. I know that I will be able to sleep at SOME point but <e3>it just feels hopeless thinking about going back to school</e3>.I just needed to express something since I can't speak at all. I am certain that when I finally show up at the hospital I can't say anything and that they will just send me home again without any meds - like all the other times where I could still actually express just a LITTLE of what I feel constantly.

I often find myself always being distracted when trying to sleep. I am not using medication, and am always for at leat an hour or two before beginning to get to bed to actually stop being distracted, not matter how exhausted I might be. Anyone else have similar problems? Any tips on how they cope with getting to sleep?

I currently got passed day 6 of my addictions. <e1>I have an addiction for distractions, escape and quick pleasures</e1>. So <e2>I removed sugar, social media, letting myself get off track when something comes to mind</e2>, trying nofap just because, <e3>spending money</e3>, and my biggest one, <e4>overcoming Maladaptive Daydreaming</e4>, which, I think overcoming everything else will rid that addictive habit specifically.When I remove these energies from my life, I noticed that I get anxious and bored. When I try to do anything productive it's taxing on my mind. It feels as if I have to force myself into doing things. So I end up sitting for hours. I also notice I'm prone to developing other bad habits, or will do extremely subtle ways to get a tiny fix. So my question is, how do I get pass this phase? How long does it usually take? Because I want to get back on track and remove all of this clutter, since, it's making me self destructive. In case you wonder how it makes me self destructive, you may ask.

It's so dumb. Maybe half the time I use it I get a high for an hour. Then it's back to being tired, lethargic and irritable.I've talked [here](https:www.reddit.comraddictioncomments3pmkk6its_only_caffeine_but_its_seriously_fucking_me_up) about why it's so bad for me. As you can see I've failed in staying off it and have to start again.I have an idea for something I'd like to work on. <e1>A tech project. But I just keep putting it off</e1> because <e2>I slept badly</e2>, because <e3>I don't feel up to it</e3>, and mostly, because <e4>I'm not on a caffeine high at that specific moment</e4> so <e5>I feel I can't do anything but browse reddit and binge eat</e5>. I've already put this project off for a ridiculously absurd amount of time. I can't put it, or anything else off, any longer.I will not drink any caffeine for the rest of January. At all. Starting now. I've thrown out my last Red Bull and Cokes. I had to tell someone so I stick to it.

My drinking can be viewed in terms of what I could get away with - and then stretching that just a little - or a lot.  I had that voice for quite a while, but I refused to listen to it - to accept that it was time to do something about my drinking  drugging.I made sure I hung out with people who were 'worse' than me, I could point to them and feel safe - my normal was over the line, but that was not something I would ever admit.I believed the lies, I believed the promises I knew would be broken, but <e1>I did not believe that little voice</e1>, because <e2>it told a truth I REALLY did not want to hear</e2>.I drank until I was 39 - claimed I was functional, in control" and by some measures I was (in my mind at least) - but I was also miserable and medicating that misery with a drug which compounded it.TLDR finding ways to keep drinking did me no good.  <e3>Controlled drinking did not work</e3> and only <e4>made me angry and constantly wanting more</e4>

Oh wait, I know I want a fucking drink.  An ice cold beer to go along with this ice cold day.  A winter ale sure would be nice right now.This is my first day I have the house to myself. So sometimes I  buy groceries by myself instead of together with my gf. She often gives me a list for dinner and other stuff we need. While in the supermarket, I would read it even 10 times, cross things off of the list in my head, thinking I won't fail, <e1>think of a random product  to buy</e1> because <e2>we surely don't have that anymore</e2>.    Then I come home, turns out I forgot something from the list, and we were not running out of said extra product at all.    Is this some unaware compensation mechanic? Thinking about buying other products in addition to the required products, while basically despite a shopping list, you try to compensate for the likelyhood of forgetting something?

As our brains are rewiring, I wonder if the withdrawal period is a destructive time to make big decisions. It may be inevitable in some cases, but what about when it isn't? Is it a good idea to make important decisions in the withdrawal phase if time isn't of the essence?As I'm mulling over a big decision, I wonder: how long does it take for our brains to rewire? Will I regret this decision later because I was going through an adjustment period?For context, I stopped smoking November 22. I unfortunately broke that with a jay on NYE. I've been clean since. <e1>I feel like I haven't found a happy space</e1> since <e2>quitting</e2>, though my mental clarity is up. Beyond that, <e3>I haven't felt happy in my relationship for some time and I'm considering ending it</e3>. I keep going back and forth, and I question whether my withdrawal is affecting this decision in a big way.Any advice is welcome. I appreciate all the support I've had from rleaves throughout this journey.

Hello leaves community,This is my first post and I've been off for about three weeks. I've found a lot of comfort from all of your posts. I know that I'm not alone and I can only hope to have the strength of those who've gone without it for so long. Asides from a binge-y night on NYE, <e1>my detox has been arduous, yet sure-coming</e1>! <e2>I feel pretty good about my progress</e2>.Lately, <e3>I've been feeling the self-consciousness and social-anxiety that I used to feel when I didn't smoke</e3>. I was always shy and introverted; social events made me uneasy. One day, I discovered that weed had a different effect on me. I became more and more extroverted! It brought me up like molly. If I took just one hit, I was transformed. It was like I was wearing The Mask." I felt smarter

<e1>I have Generalized Anxiety Disorder already</e1>, so <e2>I worry constantly about everything, to an extreme degree whether it warrants it or not</e2>. But <e3>I've noticed I make it worse for myself</e3> because of <e4>my ADD-based procrastination</e4>.<e5>I actually get physically ill on a regular basis</e5> because of <e6>how anxious I get about the things I've procrastinated over</e6>. It can be paralyzing and then I don't accomplish those things anyway. Even if I do, the guilt often continues.Does anyone else deal with this? Have you found anything to help you cope better? I wish I could be more patient and kind with myself. I'm just not sure how to get to that point.
maybe I'm just a depressed person""

This was the semester I realized <e1>I could calm my mania and numb my depression with alcohol</e1>. It was also the semester <e2>I got alcohol poisoning, drank again</e2>, got superfuckingmanic the next day, and drank again. It was the semester <e3>I thought of alcoholism as a Cool Fun way to deal with emotions</e3>. And then, when the semester ended and I went home to my family, <e4>I started to realize that it wasn't normal to get drunk every day</e4>, especially when <e5>it made my mood swings worse, especially when I'd black out and get physically aggressive with my family</e5>. But now I realize there's no Cool Fun" way to deal with bipolar disorder. You just do the necessary things to be healthy and stable

I tend to get overstimulated or feel overwhelmed easily. I work full time and am finishing up my bachelors, which I am finally nearing the end stages of but will have taken me six years to complete. I always try to remind myself that I am on my own path, and to choose my own happiness each day. However, <e1>as I sit down to plan out my next semester</e1> (which meds have allowed me to do or even consider the need for a plan) <e2>I find myself feeling mentally exhausted ; very overwhelmed with it all</e2>. This is just one example, and I know college can be stressful for everybody, but <e3>I can get this same feeling considering errands I need to run, getting ready in the morning or grocery shopping</e3>. Like it all just seems like SOMUCH and WHENAMIGOINGTODOALLOFIT and man, now I could use a nap. Anyone have any good coping strategies with feeling of overwhelm? Does this happen because we have trouble prioritising or blocking out stimulus?

Before I was diagnosed, I had a psychotic break, and in the weeks leading up to it, I was arguing with my SO a lot, and <e1>during my stay in hospital he refused to visit me and would say horrible things to me over the phone and via text.After a little while</e1>, he apologised and after my hospital stay he had be looking after me and supporting me until I got a job. My problem is I can't get over how unkind he was to me when I was in hospital, I won't go into details but it was heartbreaking and unnecessarily mean.I love him and want it to work but <e2>I find myself resentful and unable to trust him if I have a similar episode in the future</e2>. <e3>I'm even more resentful</e3> as <e4>everyone only sees how he stepped up</e4> after and keep telling me how lucky I am to have someone so supportive. I do love and appreciate all he's done for me but the past keeps eating me up inside. What can I do? <e5>I've already contacted a few couples counseling services to see if any can accommodate us</e5>, because <e6>honestly I'm losing my mind</e6>.

I've noticed what I think are changes but I can't tell if I'm just randomly feeling in a better mood or if these are potential improvements because of the drug. January 29 was the date <e1>my best friend shot himself</e1>. Fatally. <e2>I cried every damn day for three years streight, with no relief from the grief</e2>. That time of year is coming around again, and every day I say to myself, I should just do it. <e3>My life is shit, unfixable, and meaningless, I should just do it</e3>. <e4>There's suicidal ideation then there's complete fucking obsession CFO</e4>, I got that.   I know, it's such a downer to read posts by all the suffering people, I read them sometimes and I'm at a loss for words. I think somewhere deep down, we do want to help each other to relieve our guilt or something. I just can't see any viable reason to go on. <e5>I miss my buddy so damn much</e5>. I miss him every damn fucking miserable day of my life.
By some miracle she talked me down and were both fine.

My feeling, as I read in another post, is described best by <e1>the Russian word toska</e1>. <e2>It's responsible for a lot of my sadness and reflectiveness</e2>. I make many mistakes as most do, but I feel the same rules don't apply to me. <e3>My life is spinning out of my control and I feel as though there is nothing I can do to control the damage</e3>. I want to sleep forever and ever. Another word for that is *Moksha* in Indian religions, meaning a restful, dreamless, and peaceful sleep. Suicide is not an option for me, but I'm considering other ways of making my life peaceful.

I was a beer drinker. It always been my preferred drink. Usually just enjoyed drinking at home out on the back patio in nice weather especially on cool nights like these. My favorite beer has been a seasonal brew made by Sam Adams called Cold Snap. So I'm grocery shopping this evening, exhausted, thinking about work, avoiding the beer aisle, when suddenly....there it is...a huge display of Cold Snap out in the middle of the grocery store. My heart flutters for a moment. Yay! It's out again!" Then reality hits. "Oh...right...I don't drink." I just stare at the display. My head hurting and wanting nothing more than to unwind with a cold beer...my favorite fucking beer.There's a reason I've been posting

Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.RumiFor me, this quote means that my attitudes, beliefs, values and opinions are the barriers to me finding peace and love in the world. If I come at the world with the right mind, I am open to the possibilities.In my addiction and even in my recovery, I close myself off. <e1>I put up mental barriers</e1> (attitudes, expectations, unrealistic beliefs) that <e2>make me unable to see the truth or beauty in a situation</e2>.

The thing that scares me about starting this is when <e3>I started Escitalopram</e3>, <e4>it really made me feel wired</e4> and I<e5>had a nervous breakdown</e5> because <e6>I couldn't sleep for almost a week</e6>. That golden moment when we feel ourselves drifting into the darkness in the middle of the night. I know you all, every one of us stares up at the ceiling each night and prays; please God, <e1>please don't let me wake up tomorrow, let me never wake up from this slumber</e1> for <e2>I can't take another day</e2>. Every one of us on here curses the moment we wake up, wishing that we can slink back into the thoughtlessness of sleep for only another minute. We curse the seconds awake and count them down until we can curl up beneath the sheets and drift off yet again. The sleep is where we find comfort, and that great slumber is what we seek.

I have attempted to quit drinking more times then I care to admit. At first I did not consider myself an alcoholic. I just liked the binge drink on a weekly basis. But with the constant hangovers, saying stupid things to friends and family. I recognized the problem. Each time I quit for a day or two the opportunity for free booze presents itself. Mainly in my career, there is always a seminar with a happy hour to follow. I found this sub reddit over the weekend and relapsed after 2 days, I had to re-set my badge after a day of finding SD. I felt shame but I got excited about this journey. I wasn't sure what to post or what to say. However, all day today when opportunities to have a beverage with lunch or a quick stop at the kegerator were presented, I hopped on my phone read some quick posts of successes and failures and everything in between and that gives me courage. Thank you to all of you out there.

When <e1>I stopped drinking I planned on it being a short break of 3 weeks to get my head straight</e1>. I agreed to do IOP D;amp;A counseling. I figured I could quit whenever I wanted and go back to my rum. Well I didn't quit! After a few weeks of sobriety <e2>I started realizing how big my problem actually was</e2> so I decided to stay sober a bit long. <e3>But I wasn't happy. I was in total despair and agony</e3>. <e4>I hated not drinking so, so, so much. I hated being sober</e4>. But deep down I knew it was what I needed and people on this sub and in my group and AA meetings told me it would get better and easier and so I decided I had to believe them and I kept going one minute, one hour, one day at a time. And they were right and it did get better! I've am so happy and healthy (60 lbs lighter!), my marriage is amazing and my life is just so totally different in really good ways. Thanks to everyone on this sub who just posts and comments and supports each other! Truly we are accomplishing amazing things!

I feel like I can't let myself have things be good. How do you deal with or accept it when things are going well?

Whenever I feel like doing something productive, the time goes by and by the end of the day I didn't do anything at all.I'm currently on vacation from uni, I have a nice job, but days go by one by another and I never seem to gather enough energy to do the things I want to get done, like cooking something, make a gift for a friend, clean my huge mess, catching up with some hobbies, etc. <e1>Being curled up in my bed</e1> is my way to <e2>avoid thinking or worrying about anything</e2>, and then <e3>I get mad at myself for being so useless</e3>, then I stop being mad and stop caring. Whenever I'm not working I'm just sleeping or spending insane amounts of hours on the computer, feeling like I wasted another day.Everyday.

Happiness is a double-edged sword...no matter how happy you may get, you'll always end up getting stabbed in the heart by it.It is untrusting, unforgiving, it is the reason why so many are dead.<e1>I do not believe in the myth that happiness exists</e1> because <e2>I never feel it</e2>.<e3>All I feel is sadness and depression</e3>, those are true emotions that stick with you, even in your brightest hours.You will never see the dawn again, never hear the hopeful birds singing...never hear anything but that silence that is so deadly.Happiness will never thrive in this dark world, it won't even make an appearance.It has been buried along with the dreams of things finally getting better..it is a myth that needs to be put to rest next to my deteriorating soul.

I have had dreams like this but toward the end of my dreams the girl dies in some way and I wake up feeling dead inside. I just don't know what to and it's like my life is slowing down and I don't have the energy to do anything. Hell <e5>I was late for school today</e5> because <e6>I didn't want to get up</e6>. I just don't know.

So, my DUI'ed son and I went to our first AA meeting this evening. It was an open big book reading where we all took turns reading out loud a paragraph and then offering an experience related (I ended up passing- which seemed ok).I wasn't sure what to expect, and I did find that I learned a few things about what an alcoholic looks like- anyone. I think my son learned a few things, but a youth group might be more informative for him. He had a hard time relating to the 'spouse,kids, career' issues- but he did relate to the loneliness, despair ; guilt that he (and I) have felt in the past.We are going again tomorrow night- this one will be a speaker type. Kind of excited to see what the different types of meetings are and which I like the best.Anyone have a favorite format? Why?
